page.title: 01General description, Swainby
page.content: With a history of rural economy, this area now includes a good proportion of commuters to Teesside and the North- allerton administrative centres. The A19, running N-S, gives speedy access to Middlesbrough, Stockton or the A1, and the A172 carries traffic towards the coast.{Swainby}is a gateway to the NY Moors National Park; visitors are attracted by the splendid scenery of the Cleveland Hills. It is a thriving village with a post office, general store, church, chapel, school, village hall, hairdresser and craft shop. Many self-created activities and entertain- ments take place. The 6 public houses prosper from local and incoming trade. Much voluntary funding will be needed for upkeep of public buildings during the next two years.{Potto}is a quiet friendly village without shops or hall but a new village hall is planned.
